trans-unit.source: Encapsulates properties related to scrolling.
This is an abstract class.

The actual derived classes used directly by Windows Forms are <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HScrollProperties> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VScrollProperties>, which are returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.HorizontalScroll%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.VerticalScroll%2A> properties of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollProperties"></xref> class.
You cannot instantiate this class directly, as it is abstract.
You must instantiate one of its derived classes instead, such as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HScrollProperties> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VScrollProperties>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl"></xref> whose scrolling properties this object describes.
Gets or sets whether the scroll bar can be used on the container.
`true` if the scroll bar can be used; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the distance to move a scroll bar in response to a large scroll command.

<xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollProperties.LargeChange%2A> is used to determine how far the scroll bar is moved in response to a request to move a considerable distance, such as when the user presses the PAGE UP or PAGE DOWN button.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> describing how far, in pixels, to move the scroll bar in response to a large change.
<xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollProperties.LargeChange"></xref> cannot be less than zero.
Gets or sets the upper limit of the scrollable range.

If the new value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollProperties.Maximum%2A> is less than <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollProperties.Minimum%2A>, then <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollProperties.Minimum%2A> is set equal to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollProperties.Maximum%2A>.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> representing the maximum range of the scroll bar.
Gets or sets the lower limit of the scrollable range.

If the new value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollProperties.Minimum%2A> is greater than <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollProperties.Maximum%2A>, then <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollProperties.Maximum%2A> is set equal to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollProperties.Minimum%2A>.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> representing the lower range of the scroll bar.
<xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollProperties.Minimum"></xref> cannot be less than zero.
Gets the control to which this scroll information applies.
The control to which this scroll information applies.
Gets or sets the distance to move a scroll bar in response to a small scroll command.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollProperties.SmallChange%2A> is used to calculate how far to move the scroll bar in response to an arrow key click or a click on a scroll bar button.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> representing how far, in pixels, to move the scroll bar.
Gets or sets a numeric value that represents the current position of the scroll bar box.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> representing the position of the scroll bar box, in pixels.
Gets or sets whether the scroll bar can be seen by the user.
`true` if it can be seen; otherwise, `false`.
